She makes beadwork for the local and foreign market. She is seeking a loan of $900.00 from Kiva to help her expand her production.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Martha Enriqueta

texts.en:
La señora Martha tiene 55 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos, que se encuentran estudiado. Su esposo trabaja en Estados Unidos, y en ocasiones no le es posible enviar los recursos para el sustento de su familia. Para mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y para darles lo necesario, ella decidió emprender su negocio de venta de cosméticos por catálogo hace dos años, como obtuvo buenos resultados, incorporó también la venta de calzado, y ahora se han incrementado los clientes y los pedidos.

Para poder surtir la mercancía que sus clientes le han pedido, Martha necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 200 dólares que planea invertir para aumentar la variedad de sus productos y mejorar sus ganancias, ella ofrece devolver el cresito en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlos.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en:
La señora Catarina tiene 54 años de edad, por la ruptura de su matrimonio tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus cuatro hijos ella sola. Estudió un curso de manualidades que le ha servido para la elaboración y venta de arreglos florales y coronas, ella inició en su casa pero tiene la ilusión de algún día poder tener su propia florería. Con ayuda de una de sus hijas ha podido sacar adelante su negocio y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes, sobre todo cuando se incrementan en fechas especiales como el día de las madres, el día de muertos, etc.

En estos momentos Caterina requiere de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 300 dólares que utilizará en la compra del material necesario para elaborar los arreglos florales, incrementar la variedad de sus productos y obtener mayores ventas, ella ofrece regresar el préstamo en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Sé parte importante de los logros de Catalina y apóyala.

Caterina is requesting a $300 loan. She will use the loan to buy materials for floral arrangements and to increase the variety of the products she carries. She will repay the loan in 3 to 6 months. You can be part of her achievement.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha is married and the mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. Her husband is retired and her need to help with the family's financial situation lead Bertha to start selling underwear via catalogs, three years ago. She has invested a lot of hard work and time in her business in order to give her children the necessities in life and to help them to succeed.

Bertha allows her customers to purchase items with payment plans and this strategy has resulted in her business being a grand success. However, she now needs a loan for $375.00 which she will use to purchase more merchandise in order to offer her clients a wider variety of items. This is important for the growth of her business and will allow her to contribute more to her family who all thank you for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Bertha es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos todavía se encuentran estudiando. Su esposo es pensionado y la necesidad de ayudar en la economía familiar impulsó a Bertha a iniciar con la venta de ropa interior por catálogo, desde hace tres años. Ha sido mucho el esfuerzo y el tiempo que Bertha le ha invertido a su negocio, pero lo hace para darles lo necesario a sus hijos y ayudarlos a salir adelante.

Bertha les ofrece a sus clientes liquidar sus productos en cómodos pagos y esta estrategia de venta le ha funcionado muy bien. Ahora necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y contribuye a mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.en:
For eight years, Lorenza has sold food for a living, she began by selling tacos outside her home because her husband's salary was not enough to cover family expenses, but as she had many customers, with her savings she decided to open a food-stand. She is 52 years old and is the mother of 2 children. It has not been easy for Lorenza to rise above all her obstacles, but with the support of her family she has succeeded in her goals and has remained working at her food-stand.

At this time, Lorenza needs a loan for $750.00 which she plans to invest in expanding her store and to buy cooking utensils and the items necessary to fabricate her product. She is dedicated to repaying the loan within 5-10 months. You can help the development of this business, Lorenza and her family, who all sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Desde hace ocho años, Lorenza se dedica a la venta de comida, inició vendiendo tacos afuera de su casa, porque el ingreso que su esposo recibía era insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades de su familia; pero como tenía mucha clientela, con sus ahorros decidió abrir un puesto de comida, ella tiene 52 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos. No ha sido fácil para Lorenza superar todos los obstáculos, pero con la unión familiar han podido salir adelante, y permanecer por tanto tiempo en el negocio

En estos momentos Lorenza requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 750 dólares que planea invertir en la ampliación de su negocio y para la compra de utensilios de cocina y los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar el crédito en un plazo de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio, Lorenza y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Expansion and the purchase of cooking utensils.

loans.name: Lino Ventura

texts.en:
Mr Lino is 63 years old, a widower and has one son. He has worked since he was very young as a repairman, working for other people, but Mr Lino always wanted to open his own store and he succeeded in this a little while ago. He invested all the money he had in order to have his store and he now has several clients, but to increase his sales he would like to offer items on credit to his customers, but to do so, he needs a loan of $475.00, which he will use to buy tools and materials he needs to make doors, windows, banisters and protectors, which are all in high demand.

Mr Lino has worked very much and he would like to see his business to continue to grow, and with your help he can achieve this. The well-being of he and his family is in your hands, please do not hesitate to decide to help him.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El señor Lino tiene 63 años de edad, es viudo y tiene un hijo, él trabajó desde muy joven en la herrería para otras personas, pero los deseos de Don Lino eran abrir su propio taller y lo logró hace poco, invirtió todo el capital que tenia para poder iniciar su negocio, y ya tiene varios clientes, pero para incrementar sus ventas quiere ofrecer sus productos a crédito para lo que requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 dólares, que utilizará en la compra de herramienta y de los materiales que necesita para la fabricación de puertas, ventanas, barandales y protectores, que son los productos de mayor demanda.

Ha sido mucho el trabajo que ha realizado Don Lino, y quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio, con tu ayuda puede lograrlo. En tus manos está el bienestar de él y su familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyarlo.

loans.use: To purchase materials and tools.

loans.name: Antonia Guadalupe

texts.en:
Antonia is married and for seven years she has sold groceries. She began her business in order to help with household expenses and with a lot of hard work she has managed to run her business for a long time, and she also has her husband's help in his spare time. They would like to buy their own home and to have an inheritance they can pass down to their future children, which is why they have worked so hard to make their business a success.

At this time, Antonia and her husband wish to expand their business in order to increase their earnings, but to do this, they need a loan of $375.00 which they will use to buy shelves and merchandise in order to have a wider variety of products to offer to their customers. You can be an important part of Antonia and her husband's lives,please choose to help them, they sincerely appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Antonia es casada y desde hace siete años se dedica a las ventas de abarrotes, inició este negocio para ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo por tanto tiempo, recibe la ayuda de su esposo en su tiempo libre. Ellos quieren poder comprar su casa propia, para tener un patrimonio que ofrecerles a sus futuros hijos, por lo que han trabajado arduamente en su tienda. Ahora Antonia y su esposo quieren hacer crecer su negocio para poder obtener mayores beneficios, por lo que necesitan de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que utilizaran en la compra de estantes y de mercancía para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad y permanecer en la preferencia de sus clientes. Tú puedes ser parte importante en la vida de Antonia y su familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ella agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase shelves and merchandise.

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.en:
Lety sells in one of the busiest markets in the city. She has a considerable number of clients; her aim is always to please each person who approaches her kiosk. "My daughter helps me with the business. This is very important for me and gives me the support I need to move the business forward. With her help, I am able to stay open all day. We plan to buy more inventory, for which we need $1200".

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Doña "Lety" vende en uno de los tianguis mas concurridos de la ciudad manifiesta tener un considerable número de clientes, su finalidad es complacer a todas las personas que se acerquen a su puesto. "Mi hija me ayuda con el negocio eso para mi es muy importante pues me brinda el apoyo para sacar adelante la venta con su ayuda puedo mantener abierto todo el día, los planes que tenemos son comprar mas inventario para esto necesitamos $1,200. dlls".

loans.use: To buy inventory to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.en:
Maria is an active woman, very hard working and responsible. She is divorced and cares for her two children by herself, as they do not receive any help from her ex-husband. In order to give her children the basics in life, and to help pay for their schooling, she decided to undertake the business of buying and selling spare parts and repairing bicycles, in which she has invested a lot of effort and hard work in order to see it grow. It has not been easy for Maria to work and to care for her home alone.

At this time, she needs a loan of $275.00 which she will use to buy an electric air pump which she needs in order to continue offering her repair service, and in this way she can offer a better service and attract more customers. You can be an important part in Maria's success and to improve the life of this family, please choose to help them.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Maria es una mujer activa, muy trabajadora y responsable, elL. es divorciada y tiene a su cargo a sus dos hijos, porque no recibe ninguna ayuda D. su ex esposo. Para darles lo necesario a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios decidió emprender su negocio D. compra y venta D. refacciones y reparación D. bicicletas, en el cual ha invertido mucho esfuerzo y trabajo para poder hacerlo creer. No ha sido fácil para Maria trabajar y hacerse cargo D. su hogar elL. soL..

En estos momentos requiere D. un préstamo por L. cantidad D. $ 275 dólares que utilizará en L. compra D. una compresora eléctrica D. aire, que necesita para continuar ofreciendo su servicio D. reparación, D. esta manera busca ofrecer un mejor servicio y ganar más clientes. Tú puedes ser parte importante en los logros D. Maria, y mejorar L. vida D. esta familia, decídete a ayudarlos.

loans.use: To buy an electric air pump.

loans.name: Juana Fabiola

texts.en:
Juana is married and has a six month old baby. Her husband is a painter whose salary is not enough to cover the family's expenses. A year ago Juana decided to start her business to help her husband cover the expenses. Taking advantage of the fact that she lives in front of a school, she began to sell snacks and shoes.

Juana wants to offer her young son the very best, which is why she works very hard. Now she needs a loan of $250 to buy products for her stand and shoes that she gets orders for. She would like to grow along with her business. You can contribute to this, Juana is very thankful for your help.

Translated by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es casada y tiene un bebé de seis meses, su esposo se dedica a pintar casas, su ingreso no es suficiente para cubrir todas las necesidades de su familia. Hace un año Juana decidió iniciar su propio negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, aprovechando que su casa esta enfrente de una escuela, comenzó a vender frituras y botanas, así como también la venta de zapatos.

Juana quiere ofrecerle lo mejor a su pequeño hijo, por lo que trabaja muy duro. Ahora ella requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 250 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su local y el calzado que le piden sus clientes. Ella quiere creer con su negocio y tú puedes contribuir a que pueda lograrlo, Juana agradece sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell in her stand

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a very hardworking woman. She is married and has three children, two of which go to school. The youngest goest with her to her business, selling fruits and vegetables, which she started two years ago to help pay for the family's expenses. Her husband is a tinsmith withouth a permanent job, so sometimes he has little work and his income is not enough to cover the family's needs. Blanca's hard work has enabled her to get a stall in the Menchaca II market in Querétaro, Querétaro, where she is from.

Now she needs a loan of $375 to purchase products to sell, increase variety and get more clients. Become an integral part of her growth as a microentrepreneur, and help this family, they thank you for your help and care.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

Blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es casada y tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos asisten a la escuela y el menor la acompaña a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, que inició hace dos años por la necesidad de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar, ya que su esposo es hojalatero por su cuenta y en ocasiones el trabajo del él es escaso y el ingreso que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia. El esfuerzo de Blanca le ha ayudado para conseguir un local en el mercado de Menchaca II ubicado en Querétaro, Querétaro de donde es originaria.

En estos momentos necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 375 dólares que empleara en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio, tener más variedad y ganar más clientes. Conviértete en parte fundamental de su crecimiento como microempresaria, y ayuda a esta familia, ellos agradecen tu cariño y apoyo.

loans.use: Buy products to sell

loans.name: Verónica

texts.en:
Veronica is married and has four children. Her husband is a factory employee whose salary wasn't enough to support their family, so she decided to start her business six years ago. She works in the place formerly used by her mother and sells Mexican delicatessen. Her hard work has helped her retain the approval of her customers for so long.

Veronica now needs a loan of $475 to purchase wholesale the products she needs to make her food. This will give her a bigger profit and allow her business to grow. She will pay back the loan in 4 to 8 months. You can help make this family's life better, don't think twice and decide to help Veronica.

Translated from Spanish by Ari Vilhjalmsson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Verónica es casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa, sin embargo el salario que recibe no cubría las necesidades de su familia, por lo que Vero decidió iniciar su negocio, ya tenia el local que anteriormente era trabajado por su madre, y desde hace seis años Verónica se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos. El buen sazón y esfuerzo que ella le da a su negocio le ha ayudado a permanecer por tanto tiempo en el gusto de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Vero necesita de un crédito por la cantidad de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de los ingredientes que necesita para la elaboración de sus productos de mayoreo para obtener mayores beneficios y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir a mejorar la vida de esta familia, no lo dudes más y decídete a apoyar a Verónica.

loans.use: Purchase products/ ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Mr. Vélez provides services for the maintenance and repair of air conditioning units. He has been self-employed for 2 years, and has one employee helping him. "In the time I've been self-employed I have brought in a lot of new clients. Little by little I an buying the tools I need for my work, but there are expensive pieces of equipment that I have not yet been able to purchase. To buy them I need a loan of $1200".

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Vélez presta los servicios para el mantenimiento y reparación del clima artificial, el lleva 2 años trabajando por su cuenta y le apoya una persona. "En el tiempo que llevo de autoempleado he generado una buena cantidad de clientes poco a poco voy comprando la herramienta necesaria para desempeñar mi labor pero hay equipos de costos mayores que no puedo adquirir, por eso necesito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto has run a small business out his house for 3 years now. "I need to buy more merchandise and 2 pieces of furniture in which to display the products I sell. The fact is, my house is very small and I would also like to enlarge my store a bit, to have more space and to be able to offer more products for sale". He is applying for a loan of $1000 with which to buy merchandise, enlarge the store, and buy the 2 pieces of furniture in which to display his products.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Roberto tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa desde hace 3 años. “Necesito comprar más mercancía y 2 muebles para acomodar las cosas que vendo, en realidad mi casa es muy chica y también me gustaría ampliar un poco hacia adelante mi negocio para tener más espacio y poder poner más cosas en venta”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para comprar mercancía, hacer más amplio mi negocio y también compra 2 muebles.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and 2 wooden pieces of furniture for product display, and enlarge the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be used to pay the vendors from whom he buys his products, which will allow him to enjoy discounts for quick payment and give him the capacity to buy more products.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Mr. V. works in the repair and sale of audio and video accessories, exploiting the knowledge he acquired in the technical studies he completed some years ago. "I worry about how to protect my business because the insecurity in the city is alarming. I need to install a closed circuit system to safeguard my inventory. Installing the system will require an investment of $1200".

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El oficio del Sr. V. consta en la reparación y venta de accesorios para audio y video, explotando su conocimiento en la materia, mediante una carrera técnica cursada años atrás. "Mi inquietud es proteger mi negocio pues la inseguridad de la ciudad es alarmante y necesito instalar un equipo de circuito cerrado para resguardar el inventario, para esto se requiere de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: Buy a closed circuit security system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of materials with which to cover current client orders, and in the purchase of new replacement parts for bicycles.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of materials original parts for bicycles and motorcycles.

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Neng B. is 52 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 6 children.  Her husband works in a nearby hospital making $3/day.  Two of her daughters work in a garment factory, two are teachers, and the two youngest are in school.  With this loan, Neng B. will buy a variety of grocery products to sell in her small shop.  She is confident that she can begin to earn more than the $3/day that she currently makes, and as her business grows she will save money in order to send her children to University.  Without this loan, her family would not have enough income to send the youngest children to University.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Chai Ey

texts.en: Chai Ey E. owns a small grocery store in Phnom Penh, and earns about $4/day.  Her husband is a policeman and their combined income currently allows them to send their 3 children to primary school.  With this loan, Chai Ey E. will buy more grocery items as she is planning on making her shop larger.   She hopes that any future success will allow her family to live more comfortably, as well as sending her children to university.

loans.use: To buy more items for her grocery shop

payments.comment: Congratulation to Mrs. Chai Ey Eang for her successful business. As now she can pay off the loan early. She and her family would like to thanks for the impact of your loan to her business and her entire household.

loans.name: Chey

texts.en: Chey S. is a local landlord in Phnom Penh and she is using this loan to buy another home.  He husband works as a mototaxi driver and earns $2/day and 2 of her daughters work in a garment factory.  The households combined income is not enough to support their children in going to school, so instead they must work in the factories.  The house Chey S. will buy with this loan will be rented out to garment factory workers who come in for work from the provinces and are away from their families.  As she receives more income, she plans to buy yet another home for renting out until she has enough income to send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy a house for monthly rental

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Tet

texts.en: Tet V. works as a landlord and also cooks pies that she sells around the city.  She makes an average of $3/day, while her husband makes $2/day working as an electrician.  She has 2 young children that she supports, as well as her mother.  Tet V. will use this loan to repair her rental home, and also to buy a cart for her pies so that she can cover more ground in the city.  As her income grows, she dreams of supporting her children in their education (She hope they can both get PhDs).

loans.use: To repair a home for rental and to buy a pie cart to sell her delicious pies!

loans.name: Heng Srey

texts.en: Heng Srey M. is just 21 years old and already owns 1 home that she rents out to local factory workers.  Her husband works as a goldsmith and earns $5/day.  Heng Srey M. currently makes $3/day, but with this new loan she will be able to repair a second home for rental and double her income.  The extra income will be most helpful, as her and her husband support their 2 children, Heng Srey M.'s mother, and two of her nephews that have moved in from the provinces.  In the future, Heng Srey M. wants to continue building more houses for rent, and wants to send her children to university.

loans.use: To repair a home for rental

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Heng Srey Mom has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Khudoikul

texts.en:
Khudoikul D. is a member of the group “Farz”. The group was formed in August, 2005. Since that time, D. has been an active participant in MicroInvest. He is engaged in trading books and stationery in the Zafarabad district. His wife and children help him. On average he earns $150-200 per month.

Before receiving his loan, he had only $1000 in turnover. At present, he has about $1600, so the loans have helped him expand his business. He attributes his success to the micro-credit program, and he recommends it to other micro-entrepreneurs who want to be successful.

In future he plans to get more loans, increase his turnover, and open another business in a new location in town. He wants to open a large reading room in order to create jobs for others.

loans.use: Purchase books

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a farmer with a lot of experience. He has bred livestock and worked the land since his childhood. He has over 10 hectares of land. He also has livestock worth a total of $1300. This year he decided to plant 1 hectare of onions and over 5 hectares of wheat. This is his first loan. He became a member of the solidarity group “Obron” to get a loan from MicroInvest. The group chose him to be its accountant. He is responsible for collecting payments and bringing them to MicroInvest on time. He will use the loan for fertilizers and fodder for his livestock.

In future he wants to expand his production and grow melons and watermelons of good quality.

loans.use: Improving working conditions

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Habibjon

texts.en:
Habibjon produces and sells construction and household instruments. He produces the goods himself and sells them at the local market. He works together with his father and brother. The market is active on certain days of the week, and this is when he sells the goods. The rest of the time, he is engaged in production.

Since he started and developed his own business, he has been able to improve the living conditions of his family. With previous loans, he bought his working equipment, expanded his production, and also increased his working capital. He will use the next loan for the materials he needs for production.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for production.

loans.name: Zebi

texts.en: Zebi A. has sold office supplies in Chkalovsk for over 13 years. She brings the goods from Istaravshan, which is 90km from her town. Before deciding on what business to start, Zebi looked into her own life. She has three children and knows from her own experience that quality school supplies are necessary but hard to find at a reasonable price. Right now, the school season is almost over, and school bags are available wholesale at a lower price than usual. Zebi wants to buy the bags now so that she can start selling them in July and make a good profit. After doing the math, Zebi thinks that $800 is the right amount to invest.

loans.use: Purchase of school bags

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Onajon

texts.en:
Onajon has had her business for 4 years. She is married and has 3 sons. Her husband is a working migrant in Russia. When he left, all the responsibilities of providing for the children and taking care of the house fell on her shoulders.

She used an initial capital investment of $150 to start a business selling men’s underwear. She has expanded her stock of goods and is now selling men’s clothes. She will use the loan for a trip to a wholesale market in Kyrgystan, where she intends to buy summer shirts. The quality of goods sold in that market is better, and she will save money by not buying the goods locally.

loans.use: Purchase of summer shirts.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: Umar has 18 years of experience in trade. He buys his goods from Khujand, 30 minutes away from his town. When he started working in sales, he worked in a state-owned store. About 15 years ago he lost his job, but by that time he had developed good skills in trade. He started the business by buying milk products from farmers and selling them at the market. Over time he studied customer demand and modified his product line accordingly. Most of the goods he sells are perishable. He would use his loan to buy an additional refrigerator for them.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Sayed Jalal-U-Din

texts.en: Sayed Jalal-U-Din S/O Sayed Jamal-u-Din was born in 1972 and lives in District 8 of Kabul City. He is married and has six family members. He Runs a Grocery and Ice Cream shop in District 8. He Started  his business with the Ice Cream Shop and with some his income, he was able to start a Grocery Shop as well. But it was difficult to keep going, because he didn't have the funds he needed to run the business properly. Than he heard about the AFSG's loan process from one of his friends and decided to participate in that program. Through his 1st loan cycle he purchased more grocery items, and this increased the number of his customers. Now he has finished his 4th cycle loan and is in his 5th cycle. "The loans really helped me establish my business. I am really happy with it and will continue taking loans in the future." says Sayed Jalal-U-Din. He is grateful for the opportunity to make a good business.

loans.use: To purchase milk, sugar, ghee, flour and other grocery items

loans.name: Mahtab

texts.en: Mahtab is 31 years old and live in a household of seven people in District 11 of Kabul City. She has a tailoring business and sews many types of clothes like pants, coats, etc. She is participating in the loan program so she can buy a better machine, more fabric and other tailoring materials. She also has orders to sew clothes for a shop that contracts with local tailors. A new machine and sewing materials will enable her to make more clothes to sell to customers and the contractor shop. This will greatly improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Noorullah

texts.en: Noorullah S/O Sakhi Dad was born in 1973 and lives in District 8 of Kabul city. He is married and has eight family members. He is a high school graduate, but during the wars he wasn't able to start his university. After marriage, his financial situation was not good, so he decided to start his own business. He borrowed money from his friends and established a small shop in which he sold limited grocery goods which he purchased from the market. His business continued that way for one year. Then he heard about the loan program from one of his relative. His first loan enabled him to offer more items for sale, and his business grow well. Noorullah has now finished his 4th loan cycle, and is ready to go on the the 5th cycle. He is pleased with the progress of his business and wants to continue with the loan program and keep developing his store.

loans.use: To purchase tea, sugar, milk, flour and other grocery items

loans.name: Ab.satar

texts.en: Ab.Satar is a property dealer who has 6 years' experience within this field. His main business is finding houses to rent and sell to the people who want them. Afterwards, he completes the documentation work between the borrowers and owners. He wants a loan to renew and buy furniture for his shop.

loans.use: Buying furniture

loans.name: Sia Moi

texts.en: Sia Moi, daughter of Mohammad Omar, was born in 1980. She is single and lives in District 8 of Kabul City. She has studied up to secondary school after which her family didn't give her permission to study further. She wanted to complete her education and after that assist her family financially, but quiting education halted her dreams. Still, she didn't lose hope and started a shared business with her brother who runs a carpentry shop. At the start of her business she and her brother faced lots of problems because they didn't have enough money to purchase all the carpentry materials. Then she heard about AFSG's loan granting and she decided to take a loan for her business improvement. After the 1st and 2nd cycle she bought a carpentry machine which really helped them to operate more quickly in their business and increase their production. Now she is in her 4th loan cycle and wants to continue taking loans.

loans.use: Buying carpentry wood

loans.name: Habibullah

texts.en: Habibullah was born in 1972 and lives in a  household of 2 in district 8 of Kabul. He sells parts of cars and motor bikes also, but his main business is painting and designing cars. He is happy with his job and thanks to the MFI that support him to he has been able to increase his business and buy lots of materials for his shop. He believes that by being a good client he can continue to have these kinds of chances in the future.

loans.use: Buying parts of car and paint

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yem S. S. is 20 years old and sells sugar cane juice.  On an average day, she makes about $10, and her household income is complemented by the $6/day that husband makes working as a carpenter.  She also supports her father who lives in their home.  Yem S. S. will use this loan to buy a motorbike for transportation to work.  In the long-term, this will save her transportation costs, and she can also rent the motorbike out when she does not need it for additional income.  In the future, her husband and her have ambitions of starting a larger juice production business.  If this is successful, they will build a proper home for their future family.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for transportation to work

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum V. is 35 and works in a garment factory on the outskirts of Phnom Penh earning $2-3/day. Her husband is a mototaxi and earns close to $5/day. Chum V. has 4 children who all work--1 in a printing shop, and 3 that pack incense to be used at Buddhist ceremonies.

With this loan Chum V. and her husband will buy a motorbike for their daughters to get to and from work. It will save them money on transportation, and they would like to help their children since they all contribute to the household income. In the future, Chum and her husband need to build up the land around the home in order to escape from flooding during the rainy season. She also hopes to start her own tailoring business so she can provide jobs for her daughters once they are finished with school.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike for her daughters to go to and from work.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en: Sharifa, daughter of Abdullah Khan, was born in 1953. She is married and her family counts 6 people and lives in district 8 of Kabul. She is an illiterate women because when she was young girls were not allowed to go to school. She has a bead works business and through that she solves some of her financial problems. She started her business with limited resources and few materials because she didn't have enough money at that time to purchase more materials for her business. Therefore, her production was small and she could not make much income from her business. She was thinking about ways to expand her business when she heard about the loan process and decided to take a loan. She used her loans in a good way,  resulting in her business expanding, production increasing and sales improving. Sharifa has finished 3 loan cycles and now she is in her 4th cycle. She is happy with the loans and wants to continue with it because the loans had a positive impact in her business.

loans.use: Buying beads, fabric, string, needles...etc

loans.name: Pharm

texts.en: Pharm T. is a widow with 4 children.  She also has three nephews and nieces that live with her family in Phnom Penh.  Three of her children work as carpenters and make $7/day each.  Her other child sells fruit alongside her mother at the market.  Pharm T. sells soap, and has daily revenues of $43.  She will use this loan to buy more soap for her business, as well as to purchase a wider variety of bathing products that her customers like.  She hopes to continue growing her business, eventually selling her products everywhere in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more soap for selling at the local market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

Dear Kiva Lender,

Great news! Pharm Tihiv has repaid the Kiva loan early! Kiva and CREDIT MFI make every effort to be as transparent as possible so you can trust the information we give you. In this case, we didn’t let you know that the loan had been repaid at the time. Occasionally, when a loan is repaid early, the payment schedule posted on Kiva doesn’t always match the records of our micro finance partner in Cambodia, CREDIT MFI. As in life, the system doesn’t always run perfectly, but when there is a discrepancy we will alert you as soon as possible so you have all the information about your investment.

On the upside, the issue occurred because the client’s business is so successful! Your loan made that possible. Soon you will see a repayment posted on the client’s profile that is larger than the usual amount. This will end the loan and return the funds to your account. We hope you will choose to loan the repaid funds to another entrepreneur who would a like a chance to grow their business as well. 

If you have any questions, please post them as a comment on this borrowers site and I will be happy to respond. I also encourage you to write comments on the pages of your loan recipients so we can pass along your good wishes to the borrowers.

We sincerely apologize for the oversight and are putting policies in place to make sure that it doesn’t happen again. Thank you for giving poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia a chance at success! 

Best regards,

Sopheap Khiev, Kiva partnership coordinator, Cambodia
Mr. Chan Mach, General Manager, CREDIT MFI, Cambodia

loans.name: Noorullah

texts.en: Noorllah was born in 1982, lives in district 8 of Kabul, and is married. He repairs machines, diesel pumps, tires and other parts of cars. He has 4 years' experience in this business and is very happy with it. He also has a young assistant who supports him in his job, and they work together all 7 days of the week. He took a loan with the help of his neighbour to buy car parts. With this shop he supports his family financiallt.

loans.use: Buying car parts

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea R. is 46 years old and runs a small business selling pork rice, noodles, and coffee.  She earns $3.80/day, while her husband makes $3/day working as a security guard at an English school.  R. and her husband have 2 children that both work security with their father.  With this loan, she will buy wood in order to build a proper restaurant.  She is confident that this will attract more customers and increase her income.  In the future, she hopes to build a new home.

loans.use: To buy wood in order to build a proper noodle & rice shop

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Khiev N. sells perfume at the local market in Phnom Penh.  Her husband works as an officer in Parliament, and earns $4/day.  They have two children that work as electricians to help support their family.  This loan will be used for purchasing perfume to sell at both the market and in her neighborhood.  In the future, she hopes to build her own store selling perfume near her home so she can spend more time with her family and friends.

loans.use: To purchase perfume for sale at the market

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Kuch S. is 46 years old and works 3 jobs--she is a teacher, a grocer, and a kitchenware saleswoman.  Her husband is a construction worker and they have had 2 children together.  Kuch S. will use this loan to buy more grocery items and some kitchenware to sell.  As she earns more money, she would like to open a shop in her home to sell her groceries and kitchenware.  She also has hopes of sending her 2 children to university.

loans.use: Buy grocery products and kitchenware for sale

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum V. sells fried corn at the local market in Phnom Penh.  She earns about $10/day in revenue, of which $3 is profit.  Her husband is a preacher, and her earn about $1.50/day.  Chum and her husband have 3 children that live with them--1 works for a private company and earns $70/month, 1 is a garment factory worker, and 1 helps with his mother's business.  With this loan, Chum V. will buy a motorbike for transportation to and from the market.  She also has plans to use the motorbike for delivering cakes that one of her friends bakes.  As she saves up money, she wants to slowly build up the land around her house to protect her family from floods during the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for transportation to market

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: In

texts.en: In P. currently sells vegetables out of her home and at the local market.  She plans to use this loan to buy the necessary equipment for making different types of juices to sell in addition to vegetables.  In P. lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $6-7/day.  One of her children works at a garment factory, and the other is a constuction worker just like his father.  With this loan, In P. will begin selling two different types of products at the market, but she hopes to extend this to all kinds of sweets.

loans.use: Buy equipment to produce sweet juice and mixed fruit juice

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en: Ruslan Zbirnea and his wife, Vera are a young family.  Together they have four children and live in the regional center of Orhei.  Ruslan has been worried for some time about not being able to provide for his family and realized the only way to make a sustainable future for his family was to start his own business.  Ruslan comes from an agricultural background yet he has no land to start a farm.  After studying different possibilities he has decided to start growing mushrooms.  Growing mushrooms requires very little land and the initial investment is reasonable which makes it an ideal micro business startup for any entrepreneur. Ruslan decided to start growing mushrooms in his cellar of his house where all the conditions necessary to grow mushrooms (ventilation of air, humidity control and temperature) are easily maintained.  Ruslan will sell his mushrooms at the local market or to wholesalers in bulk quantities where there is a market for roughly 10-15 Kilograms per day of mushrooms.  To develop his business, Ruslan needs a loan to procure high quality spores, specific bags for growing mushrooms and to make repairs to a ventilation system.

loans.use: To purchase spores for mushrooms, specific sacks and make repairs on a ventilation system.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum K. is 44 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  Her husband is a mirror cutter, and can make $9/day, while Chum K. makes close to $10/day selling fried noodles along the road.  She is using this loan to buy some equipment for her restaurant.  As she earns more money, Chum K. would like to start a clothing shop with 10 sewing machines, and also to build a house to rent to garment factory workers.  If these businesses are successful, she would very much like to pay for all 3 of her children to go to University.

loans.use: To buy cooking equipment for her foodstall

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang S. is 35 years old and works in a garment factory in Phnom Penh.  She earns about $1.50/day and has 5 children.  With this loan she will build a home for rental to other garment factory workers.  She feels that this will provide her with more income, and may even allow her to leave the garment factory sometime in the near future.  If she is successful, she plans on sending all of her children to university.

loans.use: To build a house to rent to factory workers

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Chum

texts.en: Chum S. is 38 years old and works as a nail cleaner in Phnom Penh.  She makes about $2/day and her husband makes about $5/day working construction.  She will use this loan to buy land to build a house upon.  Chum and her husband have 3 children that are all students and they want them to live in a proper home.

loans.use: To buy land

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Thuo

texts.en: Thuo N. is 28 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 3 children.  Her husband is a mechanic and earns nearly $7/day.  This loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for taking their children to school, as well as to rent out when they are not in need of it.  Thuo N. hopes to build a concrete home and see her children finish high school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation and rental

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Cheng S. is 56 years old and a widow with 4 children.  She is blind, but has learned traditional Khmer massage and earns $2/day.  Her 4 children and 2 nephews live with her in Phnom Penh, and they all contribute to the household income and supporting their mother.  Cheng S. will use this loan to buy a motorbike for her children and nephews to get to and from work.  As the family continues to earn money, she dreams of building a concrete house so everyone can live properly together.

loans.use: To buy motorbike for her children's transportation

loans.name: Roth

texts.en: Mr. Roth P. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with his wife, Leng Vichet.  Roth works as a preacher, and earns $12/day.  His wife sells fried bananas and earns $3/day.  They have 3 children that they send to school everyday to learn.  With this loan Roth P. plans on buying a motorbike so he can preach more, and also so he can easily get to the refugee camp near the Thai border where he is planning on working next.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for transportation to his new job at a refugee camp

payments.comment: This is a correction of a previous payment posted in error.

loans.name: Noor Jahan

texts.en: Noor Jahan, daughter of Niam-U-Din, is 45 years old. She is married, has 8 family members, and right now lives in district 8 of Kabul City. She has a tailoring business and wants to take a loan for that. She is an uneducated woman because her family didn’t give her permission to study. However, she wanted to do something for her family, especially after her marriage, and that is why she started her tailoring business. She makes clothes and sells them in bazaar. When she first started her business, she didn’t have enough money. Therefore, her production was small, and she made little money. Then she heard about the loan process through AFSG from one of her friends, and she decided to start taking loans. Up to now she has taken 3 loan cycles from AFSG and wants to take a 4th cycle. Now her business has expanded, and she is making more clothes. As a result, her income has increased.

loans.use: Buying fabrics, string, etc.

loans.name: Mohammad Akbar

texts.en: Mohammad Akbar is 45 years old and lives in district 8 of Kabul, the capital of Afghanistan.  He has a catering shop and needs a loan because his shop doesn’t have enough dishes, forks, spoons, etc. He has completed 3 loan cycles with AFSG and now wants to start a 4th cycle. Before taking loans he shared a business with his friend, but it was difficult for them to earn enough income to fulfill both their needs. Therefore, they decided that one of them should keep the shop, and Mohammad Akbar agreed to take it. It was very difficult for him at the beginning to manage the shop, but after taking loans he has developed his business step by step.  Now, with more money, he wants to expand it even further.

loans.use: Buying dishes, spoons, forks, etc.

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: Abdul Latif, son of R., lives in District 8 of Kabul City. He is married and runs a grocery shop. Abdul Latif has started with the individual loan because he needed more money for his business. Now he wants to buy more groceries like soft drinks, tea, sugar, milk, etc. because he says that these goods are very much in demand by people and that he has to buy those things which can be sold quickly. He is happy with the loan process and wants to carry on with them.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, flour, sugar, tea, etc.

loans.name: Abdul Rasool

texts.en: Abdul Rasool is the son of Abdul Ghafoor. He is 24, single, and lives in District 8 of Kabul City. Abdul Rasool runs a mechanics shop where he repairs electric generators. He is a high school graduate but couldn't complete his studies due to financial problems, so he decided to quit studying and start his own business. He was good at mechanics, therefore he started repairing generators. He has taken 3 loan cycles from AFSG and now wants to take a 4th loan cycle. His business wasn't good at first but he made it better step by step by using his loans wisely. He is happy with the loan process and wants to keep going with it.

loans.use: Buying required materials
